North Korea conducts test of underwater nuclear weapons system -KCNANorth Korea has conducted a test of its underwater nuclear weapons system in a protest against this week's joint military drills by South Korea, the United States and Japan, state media KCNA said on Friday. Fri, 19 Jan 2024 02:40:24 GMT II66KSS6PRPULMWBCFGU3JNT2I https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/north-korea-conducts-test-underwater-nuclear-weapons-system-kcna-2024-01-19/Reuters世界亚太地区
Red Sea shipping attacks pressure China's exporters as delays, costs mountFor Chinese businessman Han Changming, disruptions to Red Sea freight are threatening the survival of his trading company in the eastern province of Fujian. US says Houthis launched missiles at tanker ship but no damage causedThe Iran-backed Houthi militia launched two anti-ship ballistic missiles at a U.S.-owned tanker ship late on Thursday that hit the water near the vessel but caused no injuries or damage, the U.S. military said. Fri, 19 Jan 2024 01:58:27 GMT HS4ZMJQDPJODXKO5G4产品https://www.reuters.com/world/middle-east/us-says-houthis-launched-missiles-tanker-ship-caused-no-damage-2024-01-19/Kanishka Singh, Costas Pitas世界中东地区
North Korea envoy returns after meeting Putin in MoscowNorth Korea's foreign minister returned from Russia on Friday after a rare official visit and meeting with President Vladimir Putin as part of closer cooperation that Washington said could drastically change the security threat posed by Pyongyang. Brazil's Bolsonaro's vaccination records are false, authorities sayThe vaccination records of Brazil's former president Jair Bolsonaro are false, the country's comptroller general's office said on Thursday after an investigation regarding the alleged tampering of information on his COVID-19 vaccination card. Fri, 19 Jan 2024 00:40:25 GMT MMGIC72BB5NTNC7Q6QNBEBXLRU https://www.reuters.com/world/americas/brazil-bolsonaros-vaccination-records-are-false-authorities-say-2024-01-19/Reuters世界美洲
US emphasizes 'accountability and transparency' in Nigeria security operationsSenior U.S. diplomat Victoria Nuland met Nigerian National Security Adviser Nuhu Ribadu and discussed "promoting accountability and transparency" in the aftermath of security operations in Nigeria, the State Department said on Thursday. Fri, 19 Jan 2024 00:13:00 GMT 4AXNUBCMUVNGDKBSPPBBK3Q2ZY https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/us-emphasizes-accountability-transparency-nigeria-security-operations-2024-01-19/Kanishka Singh世界非洲

Canada police suspect India link in Alberta extortion ringPolice in Canada are investigating a series of extortions and related crimes that they believe are orchestrated by a suspect in India and involve criminals in Edmonton, Alberta, targeting the region's affluent South Asian people. Thu, 18 Jan 2024 22:18:11 GMT 6PJY3BN5D5J5RECUTXV7PPSTPM https://www.reuters.com/world/canadian-police-suspect-india-link-alberta-extortion-ring-2024-01-18/Ismail Shakil世界
Port-Au-Prince residents sheltering in place as violence escalatesHaiti's capital Port-au-Prince was on lockdown on Thursday, as flaming barricades across several neighborhoods forced residents to shelter in place or return home in the latest flare-ups in chronic gang violence plaguing the Caribbean country. Thu, 18 Jan 2024 20:56:30 GMT K3BNSRLNJ5NYXF3ARCTWAOUK7Y https://www.reuters.com/world/americas/port-au-prince-residents-sheltering-place-violence-escalates-2024-01-18/Reuters世界美洲
US says 'no way' to solve Israel security, Gaza war without Palestinian stateThere is "no way" to solve Israel's long-term security challenges in the region and the short-term challenges of rebuilding Gaza without the establishment of a Palestinian state, U.S. State Department spokesperson Matthew Miller said on Thursday. Thu, 18 Jan 2024 20:16:50 GMT 6GUEP6XSOVIGTCGTTACSEO22JY https://www.reuters.com/world/middle-east/us-says-no-way-solve-israeli-security-gaza-war-without-palestinian-state-2024-01-18/Simon Lewis, Humeyra Pamuk世界中东地区
Iran-Pakistan flare-up rooted in restive borderlands, not Mideast strifeAn Iranian strike on Pakistan this week that drew a rapid military riposte and raised fears of greater regional turmoil was driven by Iran's efforts to reinforce its internal security rather than its ambitions for the Middle East, according to three Iranian officials, one Iranian insider and an analyst.
